elements.title: Israel Del Toro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite suffering burns to 80 percent of his body, Israel Del Toro (pictured) became the first member of the U.S. Air Force to re-enlist after being deemed 100-percent disabled?

elements.title: Cyclone Freddy was the longest-lasting tropical cyclone recorded (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cyclone Freddy was the longest-lasting tropical cyclone recorded?

elements.title: Daiki Kobayashi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Daiki Kobayashi was already known for his androgynous voice when he was cast as a cross-dressing idol in The Idolmaster SideM?

elements.title: an office building on New York City's Times Square (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an office building on New York City's Times Square was almost entirely vacant upon its completion?

elements.title: Ban Hyo-jin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although sport shooter Ban Hyo-jin attended Olympic trials just to gain some competition experience, she qualified for the Olympics and went on to win a gold medal?

elements.title: Love Is Embarrassing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while performing "Love Is Embarrassing", Olivia Rodrigo suffered an "embarrassing" wardrobe malfunction?

elements.title: Ivan Palmaw (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that architect Ivan Palmaw designed houses in Shanghai and Seattle after fleeing the Russian Revolution?

elements.title: One Million Monkeys Typing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a researcher called the community on the short-lived collaborative writing website One Million Monkeys Typing "astonishingly harmonious"?

elements.title: an icon of Jesus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an icon of Jesus was removed from a Catholic church for allegedly being pagan imagery?
